reviews.review: Very fun game. Seems good at first, but there's a whole lot more. Surfing, b-hopping, deathrun, and more!

very like. much shoot. such skill

Being a Casual Gamer, I don't mind this game. It helps me connect with people to other games in my library.

Dust 2 got a good upgrade since this game first released, as well as all the new maps that were polished off (but not enough to decrease my fps). A complete time waster built for friends of all ages, lizard people, and cheaters running rampant with tricksy wall hacks.

I hate the level of Himalayan salt, trans-phobia,  and disregarded misogyny that thrives in competitive matches. Competitive matches should be avoided unless you've got a buddy or team to play with anyway though since flaming your disabled teammates is often versed. If you're a n00b like me (or a woman) you can or will be singled out and kicked out of matches if you are not getting enough kills or if you simply use chat at the wrong time.

I do like finding all the chickens and making them my friend though. F to Bartholomew who was my friend for 340 sec.

Fun and enjoyable, though definitely not for everyone. Gameplay and guns feel great, but not very newcomer friendly. If you want something competitive or uptight from Valve, this is the game for you.
